meanings.definition: To suspend a meeting or session with the intention of resuming it later.
meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to adjourn the class for lunch.
meanings.sent2: The council will adjourn the meeting until next week.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels adjourned their gathering when it started to rain.
meanings.sent4: The flowers adjourned their blooming until the sun returned.
meanings.sent5: The clock adjourned its ticking until the batteries were replaced.

meanings.definition: To move from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The family will adjourn to the park for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: The crowd will adjourn to the stadium for the concert.
meanings.sent3: The ants adjourned to the kitchen in search of crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The clouds adjourned across the sky, blocking the sun.
meanings.sent5: The students adjourned to the library for a study session.
